smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'TimeDateFragment' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'GpsMapFragment' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'BaseMapFragment' with '14' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'MapViewModel' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'MapFragment' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'LocationView' with '27' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function findDirections has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: ComplexCondition
smells.description: Complex conditions should be simplified and extracted into well-named methods if necessary.

instances.message: This condition is too complex.
This condition is too complex.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class LocationView is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.description: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

instances.message: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function draw is nested too deeply.

smells.name: MatchingDeclarationName
smells.description: If a source file contains only a single non-private top-level class or object, the file name should reflect the case-sensitive name plus the .kt extension.

smells.name: FunctionNaming
smells.description: Function names should follow the naming convention set in the configuration.

instances.message: Function names should match the pattern: ^([a-z$][a-zA-Z$0-9]*)|(`.*`)$

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

smells.name: DataClassContainsFunctions

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (activeProviders.size == 1 && activeProviders[0] != "passive") are unnecessary and can be replaced with: activeProviders.size == 1 && activeProviders[0] != "passive"
Parentheses in (if (query.via == null) "null" else query.via.location) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (query.via == null) "null" else query.via.location
Parentheses around the lambda ({ onStopClicked() }) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({ onStopClicked() }) are unnecessary and can be removed.

smells.name: NestedClassesVisibility
smells.description: Nested types are often used for implementing private functionality and therefore this should not be public.

Nested types are often used for implementing private functionality. However the visibility of SavedSearchesFragment makes it visible externally.

smells.name: LoopWithTooManyJumpStatements

smells.name: ForbiddenVoid

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.
